question:
Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?

10 - 4 + 13 ÷ 15 × 3 = 71
solution:
(c)

In this type of questions we will check options one by one and doing so option c gets satisfied.

10 - 4 + 13 ÷ 15 × 3 = 71

Interchanging the signs ÷ and × we get,

10 - 4 + 13 × 15 ÷ 3 = 71

L.H.S = 10 - 4 + 13 × 15 ÷ 3

10 - 4 + 65 = 71 = R.H.S

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the given sets.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)

(16, 32, 54)

(29, 58, 80)
solution:
(c)

Logic: First number × 2 = Second number and Second number + 22 = Third Number

(16, 32, 54) → 16 × 2 = 32 and 32 + 22= 54

(29, 58, 80) → 29 × 2 = 58 and 58 + 22 = 80

Similarly,

(24, 48, 70) → 24 × 2 = 48 and 48 + 22 = 70

question:

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. For e.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)

(9, 6, 25)

(14, 5, 29)

(c)

Logic: First number + second number + 10 = Third number

(9, 6, 25) → 9 + 6 + 10 = 25

(14, 5, 29) → 14 + 5 + 10 = 29

Similarly,

(13, 9, 32) → 13 + 9 + 10 = 32

question:
Three statements are given followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.

Statements:

All metals are gold.

All jewellery are gold.

All gold are ornaments.

Conclusions:

I. Some ornaments are jewellery.

II. Some metals are jewellery.

III. All jewellery are ornaments.
solution:
(a)

Only conclusions I and III follow.

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the given set.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)

(36, 21, 35)

(43, 19, 53)
solution:
(a)

Logic: (First number - Second number) × 2 + 5 = Third number

(36, 21, 35) → (36 - 21) × 2 + 5 = 30 + 5 = 35

(43, 19, 53) → (43 - 19) × 2 + 5 = 48 + 5 = 53

Similarly,

(51, 34, 39) → (51 - 34) × 2 + 5 = 34 + 5 = 39

question: The second number in the given number pairs is obtained by performing certain mathematical operation(s) on the first number. The same operation(s) are followed in all the number pairs, EXCEPT one. Find that odd number pair.
solution:
(b)

Logic: First Number × (First number + 1) = Second Number

(15, 240) → 15 × (15 + 1) = 15 × 16 = 240

(11, 132) → 11 × (11 + 1) = 11 × 12 = 132

(16, 272) → 16 × (16 + 1) = 16 × 17 = 272

But,

(13, 180) → 13 × (13 + 1) = 13 × 14 = 182 ≠ 180

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following sets.

(5, 32, 7) → 52 + 7 = 25 + 7 = 32

(4, 30, 14) → 42 + 14 = 16 + 14 = 30

(7, 60, 11) → 72 + 11 = 49 + 11 = 60

Given Word :CAPSULE

Each vowel is changed to the previous letter and each consonants is changed to the following letter so,

New Formed Word :DZQTTMD

There are two letters in the English alphabetical series between Q and T.

question: At which Olympic Games did India win a gold medal for the first time?
solution: (c) 1928 Amsterdam. Jaipal Singh Munda was the first captain of the Indian men's hockey team at the Olympics on debut. The Indian field hockey team won Olympic gold medals - Los Angeles 1932, Berlin 1936, London 1948, Helsinki 1952, Melbourne 1956, Tokyo 1964 and Moscow 1980. Olympic Gold Medalist From India : 2008 Beijing: Abhinav Bindra (Shooting), 2021 Tokyo Neeraj Chopra (Javelin throw).

question: Identify the black soil region of India from the following.
solution: (c) Deccan trap. Black soils are found in Maharashtra, Gujarat, Western parts of Madhya Pradesh and North-Western Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, and Karnataka, the Deccan trap and the Malwa plateau. Alluvial soil - found in the regions of Indo-Gangetic plains, Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal, Assam, northern parts of Gujarat. Red soil - Found in Tamil Nadu, Bombay, Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka. Laterite soil - Found in the southern part of Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, Orissa, Jharkhand, Kerala, Assam.

question: Who is the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal?
solution: (d) Karnam Malleswari (Weightlifter). Olympic medal - A bronze medal at Sydney 2000. Indian women Olympic winners: Saina Nehwal - Bronze medal in Badminton (women's singles), London 2012. PV Sindhu - Silver medal in Badminton (women's singles), Rio 2016. Mirabai Chanu - Silver medal in Weightlifting (women's 49kg), Tokyo 2020. Mary Kom - Bronze medal in Boxing (women's flyweight), London 2012. Sakshi Malik - Bronze medal in Wrestling (women's 58kg), Rio 2016. Lovlina Borgohain - Bronze medal in Boxing (women's welterweight),Tokyo 2020.

question:
Which of the following statements are correct regarding the Union Public Service Commission?

A. The Parliament has the power to make regulations as to conditions of service of the Chairman, members and staff of the commission.

B. The Government of India Act, 1935, envisaged a Public Service Commission for the Federation and a Provincial Public Service Commission for each Province or group of Provinces.

C. The Federal Public Service Commission came to be known as the Union Public Service Commission by virtue of Clause (1) of Article 378 of the Constitution in 1950.
solution: (c) B and C only.The President has the power to make regulations as to conditions of service of the Chairman, members and staff of the commission. Union public service commission (UPSC) : Established on - 1 October 1926. Articles 315 to 323 (Part XIV) - Provides for the establishment of a Public Service Commission for the Union and a Public Service Commission for each State. Work - Recruiting civil servants. The first chairman of UPSC in independent India was H. K. Mehta.

question: Which Article of the Indian Constitution talks about 'abolition of title'?
solution: (a) Article 18 - Fundamental Right (Article 12-35, Part III). Article 20 - A fundamental right which protects the rights of the convicted person. Article 19 - Freedom of speech and expression. Article 17 - ‘Untouchability’ is abolished and its practice in any form is forbidden.

question: What is humidity?
option_1: When the water vapour transfers into water from air
option_2: When water vapour is present in the air
option_3: When the other gases transfer to air
option_4: When air is present in the water
solution: (b) Relative Humidity - The ratio of the amount of water vapour in the atmosphere to the highest amount of vapour that the air can hold. Hygrometer is an instrument used to measure relative humidity. Absolute Humidity - The quantity of water vapour present in a particular amount of air at a given time and temperature.

question: 32. The authorities of which country denied the permission to land the ship Komagata Maru, carrying Indians?
solution: (d) Canada. The Komagata Maru was a coal-transport steamship that had been converted into a passenger ship by Hong Kong-based businessman Gurdit Singh. It set off from Hong Kong in April 1914, reaching Vancouver’s harbour a month later with 376 people on board, most of them Sikhs. The steamship eventually ended up back in India on 29th Sep 1914 at Budge Budge, Calcutta.

question: During which festival is Garba performed?
solution: (b) Navratri. It is a nine day festival dedicated to the worship of Maa Durga and her nine avatars (Navdurga). Folk Dance in Gujarat: Hudo, Tippano, Bhavai, Dandiya. Festivals in Tamil Nadu - Pongal festival, Natyanjali Dance Festival, Vinayaka Chathurthi, Karthigai Deepam. Festivals in Assam : Bihu - ‘Bohag Bihu’ (Baisakh, the middle of April), ‘Magh Bihu’(the middle of January), and ‘Kati Bihu’ (Kartik, the middle of October), Dehing Patkai Festival, Ambubachi Mela, Ali Ai Ligang.

question: In December 2021, the Supreme Court suspended OBC quotas for local body elections in which of the following states?
solution: (b) Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh. In March 2021, the Supreme Court asked the state government to comply with the triple test (requires the government to complete three tasks for finalisation of reservation to OBCs in the local bodies) as a precondition for reservation to OBCs in local bodies. No state or Union territory can be permitted to hold local body elections with 27% reservation for other backward classes (OBCs) without empirical data on the population and representation of OBCs.

question: This festival was started by the Government of Nagaland in 2000 to encourage interaction among tribes and to promote the cultural heritage of the State. Identify the festival.
solution: (a) Hornbill festival. It is also called the 'Festival of Festivals’. The Festival is named after the hornbill, theglobally respected bird and which is displayed in folklore in most of the state’s tribes. Other Nagaland state festivals - Metumniu festival, Angami Naga, Sukrenye, Mim Kut, Tokhu Emong. Festivals of Manipur - Gaan-Ngai, Ningol Chakouba, Yaosang, Sangai festival, Sajibu Nongma Panba. Festivals of Odisha - Nuakhai, Konark Dance Festival, Ratha Yatra.

question: How many industries were listed in Schedule A of Industrial Policy, 1956?
solution: (b) 17. The 1956 policy divided the industries into 3 categories based on management. Schedule A Industries: It consisted of 17 industrial areas which were under the Central Government.Schedule B Industries : It consisted of 12 industries that were left to the state government to follow up with the private sector that includes compulsory licensing provisions. Schedule C Industries: It consisted of those industries which were left out of Schedule A and B and were with the private sectors and subject to licensing and regulation under the IDR Act.

question:
Identify the option that arranges the following neighbouring countries of India according to their Human Development Index (HDI) ranks in 2021-22 in increasing

Order.

Sri Lanka

Maldives

Bhutan

Bangladesh
solution: (b) a-b-c-d. Human Development Index - A measure of a nation’s health, education, and average income. India ranks 132 out of 191 countries and territories on the 2021-22 Human Development Index, tracking the global decline in human development. First ranks - Switzerland, Sri Lanka (73rd), Bhutan (127th), Bangladesh(129th), Maldives (90).

question: Asansol, Howrah, Malda and Sealdah division come under which railway zone of India?
solution: (d) Eastern Railway. Formed on - 14 April 1952 by amalgamating three lower divisions of the East Indian Railway: Howrah, Asansol and Danapur. Headquarters - Kolkata. Kalka Mail of Eastern Railway is the oldest running train in the history of Indian Railways. The West Central Railway : Headquarters at Jabalpur comprises Jabalpur and Bhopal divisions of erstwhile Central Railway and Kota division of erstwhile Western Railway. Central Railway zone Founded : 5 November 1951, Headquarters: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Mumbai. The Northern Railway - Headquartered at Delhi, established on April 14, 1952.

question: What cells help in osmoregulation in platyhelminthes?
solution: (b) Flame cells - It is found particularly in flatworms (phylum Platyhelminthes) and some other invertebrates. Platyhelminthes are the flatworms that come under the phylum of invertebrates. These are both parasitic and non-segmented acoelomates. Ganglia - A collection of neuronal bodies found in the voluntary and autonomic branches of the peripheral nervous system (PNS). Nerve cell (neuron) - The basic unit of communication in the nervous system. Hooks - Structures present in parasitic organisms. It aids the organism in getting attached to the organs of the host.

question: Who became the first woman officer to join Army Aviation Corps as Combat Aviator after the successful completion of training in May 2022?
solution: (a) Captain Abhilasha Barak. She has been awarded the Coveted Wings along with 36 Army Pilots by Director General and Colonel Commandant Army Aviation. Captain Shiva Chouhan of Fire and Fury Corps became the first woman officer to to be operationally deployed in Siachen, the world's highest battlefield.

question: Malik Ambar, who resisted Mughals in Deccan, was an able administrator of which state?
solution: (d) Ahmednagar. Malik Ambar was an African-origin statesman and military leader who served as the regent of the Nizam Shahi dynasty in the Deccan, of Ahmadnagar (now part of Maharashtra). He changed the capital from Paranda to Junnar and founded a new city, Khadki which was later on changed to Aurangabad by the Emperor Aurangzeb. He is especially famous for the Neher water system of the city.

question: Who among the following is associated with the musical instrument Surbahar?
solution: (a) Annapurna Devi. Awarded - Padma Bhushan in 1977. Other Surbahar musicians - Kushal Das, Imrat Khan, Mushtaq Ali Khan, Hiren Roy, Irshad Khan. Santoor - Shiv Kumar Sharma, Sedat Anar, Satish Vyas, Rafiki Jazz, Bhajan Sopari. Sarod - Sharan Rani, Shyamal Sinha, Partho Sarothy, Rajeev Taranath.

question: President Ram Nath Kovind conferred which award on Matha B Manjamma for Jogati Nrithyaa in 2021?
solution: (b) Padma Shri. Manjamma Jogathi (folk dancer) - Karnataka. In 2019, she became the first transgender woman to be the president of Karnataka Janapada Academy, state's top institution for folk arts. Other awards: Rajyotsava award (2010), Karnataka Janapada Academy Award (2006).

question: Who among the following sportspersons was awarded the Chhattisgarh Veerni Award 2021?
solution: (c) Dutee Chand holds the national record of 11.22 secs in 100 m.Shikhar Dhawan (Cricketer) - Arjuna Award 2021. Bajrang Punia (Wrestler) - Won a bronze medal at Tokyo 2020. PV Sindhu (Tennis) - Padma Shri (2015), Padma Bhushan (2020), Arjuna Award (2013), Silver medal at Rio OLympics 2016, Bronze medal at Tokyo Olympic 2020, the first Indian woman to win two Olympic medals.

question: Ferns, horsetails and lycophytes belong to which of the following groups?
solution: (b) Pteridophyta are spore-producing vascular plants. Bryophytes - The amphibians of the Plant Kingdom and they need water for fertilisation. Example - Liverworts, Mosses Funaria. Gymnosperms - Naked seeded vascular plants. Example - Cycas, Pinus, Cedrus. Angiosperms - Flowering vascular plants. Example - Rose, Mango, Wheat.

question: The Ashtadhyayi of Panini is a renowned work on______.
solution: (d) Sanskrit Grammar. Ancient Authors and books : (Kautilya) Chanakya's work - “Arthashastra” (on statecraft, political science, economic policy and military strategy). Megasthenes - “Indica” (ancient Indian society, economy, and culture). Maharshi Charak - “Charaka Samhita” (a famous text of ayurveda) - Ayurveda. “Sushruta Samhita” - A comprehensive textbook on medicine and surgery.

question: Which of the following statements is NOT correct about surface tension?
option_1: Surface tension is typically measured in dynes/cm.
option_2: The shape of water drop is spherical due to surface tension.
option_3: At room temperature, surface tension of water is less than ethyl alcohol.
option_4:
The cohesive forces between liquid molecules are responsible for the phenomenon known

as surface tension.
solution: (c) Surface Tension: The property of the surface of a liquid that allows it to resist an external force, due to the cohesive nature of its molecules. The surface tension of ethyl alcohol is lesser than that of water and this is because water molecules are highly polar, which leads to strong hydrogen bonding between water molecules. Resulting in a relatively high surface tension for water.

question: M2 is one of the measures of money supply. M2is the sum of M₁ +________.
solution: (a) Saving deposits with the post office. M1, M2, M3, M4 is the measure of money supply. M1 is the most liquid and makes transactions the easiest, while M4 is the least liquid. M1,M2 - Narrow Money. M3,M4 - Broad Money. M1 = Currency with the public + Demand deposits in bank + Other deposits with RBI. M3= M1+ Time Deposits with the banks. M4 = M3 + Total Deposits with Post Office Savings Organisation.

question: 49. In which year was the Vernacular Press Act enacted in British India?
solution: (d) 1878. The Vernacular Press Act, 1878 was enacted to curtail the freedom of the Indian press and limit the expression of criticism towards British policies. Proposed by - Lord Lytton, the then Viceroy of India (1876-80). Purpose of the act - To prevent the local press from expressing criticism of British policies. This act was abolished by Lord Ripon (Viceroy - 1880-84).

question:
Which of the following is the correct Lewis structure of O3?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694257470/word/media/image60.png
solution: (d) Lewis structure:A graphical representation of a molecule, showing the arrangement of atoms and valence electrons using dots to depict bonding and lone pairs. The O3 molecule has no net charge, the Lewis structures reveal a +1 charge on the central oxygen and a -1 charge on the singly bonded oxygen.

question: The cube of the difference between two given natural numbers is 1728, while the product of these two given numbers is 108. Find the sum of the cubes of these two given numbers.
solution:
(a)

Let the numbers be a and b.

According to question,

(a - b)3 = 1728 ⇒ (a - b) = 12

a = 12 + b ---------(1)

ab = 108 -----------(2)

From the above equations,we get

a = 18 and b = 6

Therefore, 183 + 63 = 6048

question: 30 men can complete a work in 12 days. After 6 days, 24 more men joined them. How many days will they now take to complete the remaining work?
solution:
(a)

Let the efficiency of a man be 1 unit.

Then, total work = 30 × 1 × 12 = 360 units

Work done in 6 days = 1 × 30 × 6 = 180 units

Remaining work = 360 - 180 = 180 unit

According to question,

Required time = 180(30 + 24) = 313 days

question: A thief is spotted by a policeman from a distance of 400m. When the policeman starts chasing, the thief also starts running. If the speed of the thief is 32km/h and that of the policeman is 40 km/h, then how far would the thief have run before he is overtaken?
solution:
(d)

According to question,

Relative Speed = (40 - 32) = 8 km/h

Time when police overtake the thief = 400 × 188 × 5 = 180 sec.

Distance covered by thief = 180 × 32 × 518 = 1600 meter

question: The cube of the difference between two given natural numbers is 1728, while the product of these two given numbers is 108. Find the positive difference between the cubes of these two given numbers.
solution:
(b)

Let the numbers be a and b.

According to question,

(a - b)3 = 1728 ⇒ (a - b) = 12

a = 12 + b ---------(1)

ab = 108 -----------(2)

From the above equations,we get

a = 18 and b = 6

Therefore, 183-63 = 5616

question:
Study the following table and answer the question below.

What is the ratio of the total number of male students to that of female students who opted for Biology in schools A and D together?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/images/mceu_55983381011694408603937.png
solution:
(d)

According to question,

Total number of male students who opted in biology in school A and D

900 × 30100 × 715 + 800 × 18100 × 512 = 126 + 60 = 186

Total number of female students who opted in biology in school A and D

900 × 30100 × 815 + 800 × 18100 × 712 = 144 + 84 = 228

Required Ratio = 186 : 228 = 31 : 38

question: A conical tent of height 10m and base diameter 48m was erected by a company in a park. Find the curved surface area of the tent (in m²).
solution:
(d)

Curved surface area of Cone = πrl

According to question,

l = 242 + 102 = 26 m

Curved surface area of Cone = π × 24 × 26 = 624πm2

question:
The number of sport bicycles sold by a shopkeeper in five years is shown in the following bar graph.

What is the percentage of decrease in the sale of sport bicycles in the year 2021 over that in the previous year?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/images/mceu_83808970111694409449823.png
solution:
(d)

According to question,

Required % = 200 - 145200 × 100 = 27.5 %

question: Using trigonometric formulas, find the value of sin(x - ysin(x + ytanx + tan y)tanx - tan y)
solution:
(d)

sin(x - ysin(x + ytanx + tan y)tanx - tan y)

= sin x cos y- cos x sin ysin x cos y + cos x sin ytan x + tan ytan x - tan y

= sin x cos y- cos x siny cos x cos ysin x cos y + cos x sin ycos x cos ytan x + tan ytan x - tan y

= tan x - tan ytan x + tan ytan x + tan ytan x - tan y = 1

question: Simplify the given expression. (326 + 222 )2 - (326 - 222 )2 ( 326 × 222)
solution:
(b)

(a + b)2 - (a - b)2 = 4ab (326 + 222)2 - (326 - 222)2 (326 × 222) = (4 × 326 × 222) (326 × 222)= 4

question: The third proportional to (x² - y²) and (x - y) is:
solution:
(b)

Third proportional = b2a

According to question,

(x - y)2(x2 - y2) = (x - y)(x - y) (x + y)(x - y)= (x - y)(x + y)

question:
A shopkeeper offers the following two discount schemes.

Two successive discounts of 10% and 15%

Buy 5 get 2 free.

Which scheme has the maximum discount percentage?
option_3: A and B both have the same discount percentage
solution:
(b)

According to question,

A:- net discount % = 10 + 15 - 10 × 15100= 23.5 %

B :- discount % = 25 + 2 × 100 = 28.57 %

Clearly, we can see that scheme B has the maximum discount.

question: A can finish a work in 20 days and B can complete the same work in 15 days. B worked for 9 days and left the job. In how many days can A alone finish the remaining work?
solution:
(b)

According to question,

Work done by B in 9 days = 4 × 9 = 36 units

Remaining work = 60 - 36 = 24 units

Required time = 243 = 8 days


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694257470/word/media/image64.png

question: Two trains P and Q of lengths 320 m and 540 m, respectively, are running in the same direction on parallel tracks at 108 km/h and 144 km/h, respectively. How much time will the trains take to cross each other completely?
solution:
(a)

According to question,

Relative Speed = 144 - 108 = 36 km/hr

Total distance = 320 + 540 = 860 m

Required time = 860 × 1836 × 5 = 86 sec

question: 10 men can do a work in 25 days. After 12 days of work, 3 more men were engaged to finish the work. The number of days required to complete the remaining work is:
solution:
(a)

Let the efficiency of a man be 1 unit.

According to question,

Total work = 10 × 1 × 25 = 250 units

Work done by 10 men in 12 days = 10 × 1 × 12 = 120 units

Remaining work = 250 - 120 = 130 units

Required time = 13010 + 3 = 10 days

question: If the simple interest for 5 years is equal to 25% of the principal, then the interest will be equal to the principal after ______years.
solution:
(a)

Let the principal be 100 unit

According to question,

Interest in 5 years = 100 × 25100 = 25 units

Required time = 525 × 100 = 20 years

question: Which of the following numbers will completely divide 412 + 413 + 414 + 415 ?
solution:
(d)

412 + 413 + 414 + 415

= 412 1+ 41 + 42 + 43

= 412 85 = 412 17 × 5

Here, we can clearly see that 17 is a factor.

So, the given numbers are divisible by 17.

question: If cot A = 12 5 , then the value of (sin A + cos A) × cosec A is _____________ .
solution:
(b)

Given, cot A = 125

(sinA + cosA) × cosec A = 1 + cot A

= 1 + 125 = 175

question: Raj's income is ₹45,000 and his expenditure is ₹33,000. If his income is increased by 20% and expenditure by 12%, then what will be the percentage increase in saving?
solution:
(d)

According to question,

Initial saving of raj = 45000 - 33000 = 12000 Rs.

His saving after increment = 45000 × 120100 - 33000 × 112100 = 17040 Rs.

Required % = 17040 - 1200012000 × 100 = 42 %

Short tricks :-

Income = Expenditure + Savings

45 = 33 + 12

+20%= +12% +

x% = +20% + 33 × 812 = 42%

question: Which of the following numbers is divisible by 24?
solution:
(b)

24 = 3 × 8

So, the given number must be divisible by 3 and 8.

In 52668 → last 3 digit is not divisible by 8

In 49512 → sum of digits = 21 and 5128 = 64 [ divisible by 24 ]

In 64760 → sum of digits = 23 [ not divisible by 3 ]

In 26968 → sum of digits = 31 [ not divisible by 3 ]

question: The average weight of a team of 20 people was calculated to be 59.8 kg and it was later discovered that one weight was misread as 68 kg instead of 77 kg. The correct average weight is:
solution:
(c)

Total weight of 20 people = 59.8 × 20 = 1196 kg

According to question,

Required average = 1196 + 77 - 6820 = 60.25 kg

question: Let A, B, C be the mid-points of sides PQ, QR PR, respectively, of △PQR. If the area of △PQR is 32cm², then find the area of △ABC.
solution:
(d)

Theorem : Area of the Triangle formed by Joining the Middle Points of the Sides of a Triangle is Equal to One-fourth Area of the given Triangle.

According to question,

Required area △ABC= 324 = 8 cm²


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694257470/word/media/image66.png

question: Two concentric circles of radii 15 cm and 13 cm are given. Find the length of the chord of the larger circle which touches the smaller circle.
solution:
(c)

By using pythagoras theorem,

PM = 152 + 132 = 56 = 214

Then, Length of chord (PQ)= 2 × 214 = 414


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694257470/word/media/image67.png

question: On purchase of articles worth ₹10,000, a shopkeeper offers a flat discount of ₹500 to his customers. Further, by shopping using a credit card, he gives an additional discount of 7%. If a customer purchases article worth Rs.10000 using a credit card, then how much is he/she required to pay?
solution:
(a)

According to question,

Cost price of article = 10000 Rs.

1st discount = 500 Rs. and 2nd discount = 7%

Required price of the article = 10000 - 500 × 93100= 8835 Rs.

question: If tanA2 = x, then find x.
solution:
(c)

sin A2 = (1 - cosA)2

And, cos A2 = (1 + cosA)2

Given, tan A2 = x

= (1 - cosA)2 ÷ (1 + cosA)2= (1 - cosA)2 × 2(1 + cosA) = (1-cosA)(1+ cosA)

Formula :-

tan A2 = (1 - cosA)(1 + cosA)

question: Two circles of radii 10 cm and 5 cm touch each other externally at a point A. PQ is the direct common tangent of those two circles of centres O1 and O2, respectively. The length of PQ is equal to:
solution:
(a)

Direct common tangent = 2r1 r2

According to question,

Required length of PQ = 210 × 5 = 102 cm

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined word in the given sentence.

Last week's rain ravaged the whole city.
solution:
(c)Ruined- destroyed or severely damaged.

Ravaged- to cause great damage to something or someone.

Reaffirmed- to state something again clearly and firmly.

Rescinded- to state that a law or decision is no longer valid.

Retracted- withdrawn or taken back, typically a statement or promise.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

National development is defined as an improvement in people's daily arrangements, the provision of fundamental necessities to citizens such as food, education, social services, medical help, and so on, as well as an increase in per capita income.
solution:
(d)Living conditions

The phrase 'living conditions' means the overall quality of life, including things like housing, health, education, income, safety, and the environment. The given sentence states that national development is defined as the improvement in the overall quality of people's lives. Hence, 'living conditions' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the word with the correct spelling from the options given below to fill in the blank.

They saw the beautiful_______of the Gods in the Temples.
solution:
(a)Idols

‘Idols’ means objects of worship or admiration. The given sentence states that they saw the beautiful idols of the Gods in the Temples. Hence, ‘idols’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined words in the given sentence.

The traffic sergeant proved through the test that Raj was under the influence of drugs and alcohol.
solution:
(a)Inebriated- under the influence of drugs and alcohol.

Simonised- to shine or polish to a high sheen, esp. with wax.

Ponied- acted or paid like a pony, often used in the context of a financial transaction.

Pocked- having holes or hollow marks on the surface.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

He does not buy shirts.
option_3: Shirts were not been bought by him.
solution:
(a)Shirts are not bought by him. (Correct)

(b) Shirts are not brought by him. (Incorrect word)

(c) Shirts were not been boughtby him. (Incorrect Tense)

(d) Shirts were not bought by him. (Incorrect Tense)

question: Identify the sentence that correctly uses the indefinite article.
option_1: She purchased a apple in the market with me.
option_2: She purchased an apple in the market with me.
option_3: She purchased apple in the market with me.
option_4: She purchase a apple in the market with me.
solution:
(b)She purchased an apple in the market with me.

Article ‘A’ is used before the words starting from a consonant sound - (a European, a story). Whereas, the article ‘An’ is used before the words starting from a vowel sound(an indian artist, an apple). Going through the options, the sentence given in option ‘b’ has the most appropriate use of the indefinite article.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

She is building a new house.
option_1: A new house is being built by her.
option_4: A new house has been built by her.
solution:
(a)A new house is being built by her. (Correct)

(b) She had built a new house. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)

(c) She has built a new house. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)

(d) A new house has been built by her. (Incorrect Helping Verb)

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word.

The company was engaged in spurioustrade practices.
solution:
(b)Fraudulent- dishonest and illegal.

Spurious- not genuine; false or fake.

Effective- producing the desired result or having the intended impact.

Spacious- having ample space, roomy and large.

Trendy- fashionable, currently popular or in vogue.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Intriguing
solution:
(d)Interesting - attracting one's attention because it is exciting.

Intriguing- very interesting because of being unusual or mysterious.

Glorifying- praising or honoring something or someone.

Ravishing- extremely beautiful or attractive.

Stunning- astonishingly beautiful or impressive.

question:
The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don't find any error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

Sajni had / interfere in / this matter.
solution:
(a) interfere in

‘Has/have/Had’ always takes the third form (past participle) of the verb. However, the past participle form of ‘interfere’ is ‘interfered’. Hence, ‘had interfered in’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below. While the first and the last sentences (S1 and S6) are in the correct order, the sentences in between are jumbled up and named P, Q, R, S. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

(S1)Today, the world has become a much smaller place, thanks to the adventures and miracles of science.

(P) We are slowly realising that the world is a single cooperative group.

(Q) Other religions have become forces with which we have to reckon, and we are

seeking for ways and means by which we can live together in peace and harmony.

(R) Mingling of population is bringing about interchange of thought.

(S) Foreign nations have become our next-door neighbours.

(S6) We cannot have religious unity and peace so long as we assert that we are in possession of the light and all others are groping in the darkness.
solution:
(a)S, R, P, Q

Sentence S will follow sentence 1 as it states that foreign nations have become next door neighbours as a result of advancements in science. And, Sentence R states that mixing up of people from various regions is leading to the exchange of ideas and thoughts. So, R will follow S. Further, Sentence P talks about the realisation that the world is interconnected and interdependent. And Sentence Q states the challenges of coexisting peacefully with different religions. So, Q will follow P. Going through the options, option (a) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

Bad iron
solution:
(c)Bad iron - bad luck.

E.g.- Spilling coffee on my white shirt before the presentation was another instance of bad iron.

question: Select the sentences that contains no spelling errors.
option_1: The mall road of our city is always teyming with street vendors.
option_2: The mall road of our city is always tiiming with street vendors.
option_3: The mall road of our city is always tyming with street vendors.
option_4: The mall road of our city is always teeming with street vendors.
solution:
(d)The mall road of our city is always teeming with street vendors.

‘Teeming’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the following sentence.

I always enjoy the company of respectful teachers.
solution:
(c)Dutiful-happy to respect and obey somebody.

Admiring- to regard with wonder, pleasure or approval.

Derogatory- disrespectful, belittling, or insulting.

Insolent- disrespectful in speech or behaviour.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

A sentimental memory of the past
solution:
(b)Nostalgia-A sentimental memory of the past.

Hysteria- extreme fear, excitement, anger, etc. that cannot be controlled.

Mania- an excessive enthusiasm or desire.

Euphoria- a feeling or state of intense excitement and happiness.

question:
Select the most appropriate idiom or phrase to fill in the blank in the given sentence.

Sweety has been_______ since her painting won first prize.
solution:
(d)walking on air

The idiom ‘Walking on air’ means to feel extremely excited or happy. The given sentence states that Sweety has been feeling extremely happy since her painting won first prize. Hence, ‘walking on air’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word given in brackets to fill in the blank.

He became _______(verbose) after a few drinks.
solution:
(d)Talkative- one who likes to talk a lot.

Verbose- using too many words.

Aggressive- hostile or forceful behaviour.

Decisive- able to make decisions quickly.

Exhaustive- including everything possible.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

A large number of fish swimming together
solution:
(a)Shoal-a large number of fish swimming together.

Stream- a flowing body of water.

Sheaf- a bundle of harvested crops or papers.

String- a thin cord or thread.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Eloquent
solution:
(c)Impotent-lacking power and strength.

Eloquent- having the power of fluent, forceful, and appropriate speech.

Modest- neither too small nor too large.

Crucial- very important.

Humble- having a modest opinion of oneself.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blanks.

As cattle are to herd so are birds to_______.
solution:
(a)Flock

‘Herd’ is a number of cattle living or feeding together. Similarly, ‘flock’ is a group of birds.

Hence, ‘flock’ is the most appropriate answer.

Litter - a group of baby animals born to one mother at the same time.

Pack - a group of animals, typically wolves or dogs, that live and hunt together.

Streak - a line or mark of a different substance or colour from its surroundings.

question:
Cloze Test:-

All state universities and colleges in Uttar Pradesh, one of the (96)_______in India, will now (97)______ a "save water" ritual named 'Jal Bharo' in place of 'lamp lighting' to inaugurate their annual convocations. The governor of the state, who is also chancellor of state universities, instructed that every university and college in the state should install rainwater harvesting plants on its campus. 'Jal Bharo' signifies (98)_______the vision of 'Jal Shakti'. This ceremony symbolises the (99)_______ importance of water conservation, whereas the lamp lighting ceremony symbolised removing darkness through education and spreading the light of learning. It is really a (100) _________ initiative. Every educational institute in India should ensure to save and recharge groundwater by installing rainwater harvesting plants. These kinds of initiatives provide awareness of using and saving water, the elixir of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 96.
solution:
(c)Biggest states

“One of the + Superlative degree adjective(best, worst, etc) + Plural Subject(states)” is grammatically the correct structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘biggest states’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :-

All state universities and colleges in Uttar Pradesh, one of the (96)_______in India, will now (97)______ a "save water" ritual named 'Jal Bharo' in place of 'lamp lighting' to inaugurate their annual convocations. The governor of the state, who is also chancellor of state universities, instructed that every university and college in the state should install rainwater harvesting plants on its campus. 'Jal Bharo' signifies (98)_______the vision of 'Jal Shakti'. This ceremony symbolises the (99)_______ importance of water conservation, whereas the lamp lighting ceremony symbolised removing darkness through education and spreading the light of learning. It is really a (100) _________ initiative. Every educational institute in India should ensure to save and recharge groundwater by installing rainwater harvesting plants. These kinds of initiatives provide awareness of using and saving water, the elixir of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 97.
solution:
(a)Organise

‘Modal verbs’ are auxiliary verbs(also called helping verbs) like can, will, could, shall, must, would, might, and should. However, after a modal verb, we generally use the first form of the verb (V1). Hence, ‘organiseV1’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:

All state universities and colleges in Uttar Pradesh, one of the (96)_______in India, will now (97)______ a "save water" ritual named 'Jal Bharo' in place of 'lamp lighting' to inaugurate their annual convocations. The governor of the state, who is also chancellor of state universities, instructed that every university and college in the state should install rainwater harvesting plants on its campus. 'Jal Bharo' signifies (98)_______the vision of 'Jal Shakti'. This ceremony symbolises the (99)_______ importance of water conservation, whereas the lamp lighting ceremony symbolised removing darkness through education and spreading the light of learning. It is really a (100) _________ initiative. Every educational institute in India should ensure to save and recharge groundwater by installing rainwater harvesting plants. These kinds of initiatives provide awareness of using and saving water, the elixir of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 98.
solution:
(d)Strengthening

‘Strengthening’ means making something stronger. The given passage states that ‘Jal Bharo' indicates strengthening the vision of 'Jal Shakti'. Hence, ‘strengthening’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:

All state universities and colleges in Uttar Pradesh, one of the (96)_______in India, will now (97)______ a "save water" ritual named 'Jal Bharo' in place of 'lamp lighting' to inaugurate their annual convocations. The governor of the state, who is also chancellor of state universities, instructed that every university and college in the state should install rainwater harvesting plants on its campus. 'Jal Bharo' signifies (98)_______the vision of 'Jal Shakti'. This ceremony symbolises the (99)_______ importance of water conservation, whereas the lamp lighting ceremony symbolised removing darkness through education and spreading the light of learning. It is really a (100) _________ initiative. Every educational institute in India should ensure to save and recharge groundwater by installing rainwater harvesting plants. These kinds of initiatives provide awareness of using and saving water, the elixir of life.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 99.
solution:
(c)Immense

‘Immense’ means extremely large or great, especially in size or degree. The given passage states that this ceremony symbolises the extremely great importance of water conservation. Hence, ‘immense’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:

All state universities and colleges in Uttar Pradesh, one of the (96)_______in India, will now (97)______ a "save water" ritual named 'Jal Bharo' in place of 'lamp lighting' to inaugurate their annual convocations. The governor of the state, who is also chancellor of state universities, instructed that every university and college in the state should install rainwater harvesting plants on its campus. 'Jal Bharo' signifies (98)_______the vision of 'Jal Shakti'. This ceremony symbolises the (99)_______ importance of water conservation, whereas the lamp lighting ceremony symbolised removing darkness through education and spreading the light of learning. It is really a (100) _________ initiative. Every educational institute in India should ensure to save and recharge groundwater by installing rainwater harvesting plants. These kinds of initiatives provide awareness of using and saving water, the elixir of life.

solution:
(a)Laudable

‘Laudable’ means deserving to be praised or admired. The given passage states that It is an initiative which really deserves to be praised. Hence, ‘laudable’ is the most appropriate answer.
